author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Collector T.N. Hariharan giving away a mobile phone to an SHG trainer in Dindigul on Tuesday.— PHOTO: G. Karthikeyan

‘Amma’ mobile phones were distributed to SHG trainers in panchayat unions in Theni and Dindigul districts here on Tuesday.

Handing over the mobile phones to community SHG trainers at a function held here on Tuesday evening, Collector N. Venkatachalam said that the handset has a 3G sim card. Tamil Nadu Women Development Corporation will foot the monthly rent of the connection. The phone has camera and GPRS facilities.

Under this scheme, mobile phones were given to 318 trainers manning 4,626 SHGs in the district.

A total of 6.08 lakh SHGs were functioning in the State of which 4.25 lakh SHGs were in rural areas. They were monitored by around 20,000 community SHG trainers, he added.

Dindigul

Collector T.N. Hariharan said that the mobile phones would help the trainers supervise the work of all SHGs. Special Tamil software was loaded in the phones to upload data, he added.

One trainer had to monitor 15 SHGs in each panchayat union. They would monitor SHG meetings, savings accounts, disbursal of loan among themselves, credit link with banks and proper maintenance of all registers, he added.

Virudhunagar

Collector V. Rajaraman launched ‘Amma’ mobile phone scheme for self-help group trainers in Virudhunagar district on Tuesday by distributing the gadget to 512 trainers.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Rajaraman said that mobile phones had been provided to 305 trainers under Rural Livelihood Mission and 207 trainers under Pudu Vaazhvu Thittam. The special software in the phones would render information management easier for the trainers, according to an official press release.
title: ‘Amma’ mobile phones for SHG trainers
